Name: Stela of Anku
Description: This limestone stela with rounded top dates to the late Middle Kingdom. Texts and representations have been cut into the stone, the representations are partly worked in relief. There are still traces of paint to be seen. In the lunette are two udjat-eyes. Underneath is the offering formula in three lines. In the upper register is a man depicted with a jar in his hand in front of a richly laden offering table. A woman is kneeling in front of him. She is holding a lotus flower to her nose. The lower register has almost the same layout, except that the attributes in the hands of the figures have been swapped around.
